hints.content:
These expressions will solve how many marbles are in each of Pooja's bags.

$54 \div 9 = \fbox{?}$

$9 \times \fbox{?} = 54$

question.content:
Pooja has $54$ marbles. She is putting an equal number of marbles into $9$ bags.

**Which equations will help us find out how many marbles Pooja puts in each bag?**


[[☃ radio 1]]

hints.content:
$\begin{align}
\$5 \times 15 &= \$75\\ 
\$4 \times 150 &= \$600\\ 
\end{align}$

We can add all of these costs together to get the total cost.
The supplies will cost $\$675$.

question.content:
Mrs. Smith is getting her classroom ready for a new school year. She has decided to buy the supplies in the table below for her new students. The table is divided into categories for writing, reading, and decoration.

**How much will all of the writing supplies cost?**  
$\$$ [[☃ input-number 1]]

Category | Supplies | Cost per item| Number of items
-|-|-|-
Writing | Markers | $\$5$ | $15$
Writing | Paper | $\$4$ | $150$
Reading | Books | $\$20$ | $5$
Decoration | Map | $\$15$ | $1$

hints.content:
Lecture: $\blue{1 \frac{1}{2}} \text{ hours}$  

Pilot training: $\frac{1}{2} \text{ hour} \times 13 \text{ martians} = \frac{13}{2} \text{ hours} = \pink{6 \frac{1}{2}} \text{hours}$  

Lunch break: $\green{1} \text{ hour}$

Landing training: $\frac{1}{4} \text{ hour} \times 13 \text{ martians} = \frac{13}{4} \text{ hours} = \purple{3 \frac{1}{4}} \text{hours}$  

Travel to Earth: $\red{\frac{3}{4}} \text{ hour}$

$\blue{1 \dfrac{1}{2}} + \pink{6 \dfrac{1}{2}} + \green{1} + \purple{3 \dfrac{1}{4}} + \red{\dfrac{3}{4}}$

$\blue{1 \dfrac{2}{4}} + \pink{6 \dfrac{2}{4}} + \green{1} + \purple{3 \dfrac{1}{4}} + \red{\dfrac{3}{4}} = 11 \dfrac{8}{4} = 13$

No, the Martian king will not make it to Earth in time to take over.  
It will take $13$ hours to get to Earth.

He would have needed another $60$ minutes to take over Earth.

question.content:
A Martian king is preparing for an invasion of Earth. He has twelve hours to train all the Martians who work on his spaceship and get to Earth. He wants to train thirteen Martians.

To train the Martians, he needs to do these five things:  

- Give all of them a lecture (this only needs to be done once, and takes $1\frac{1}{2}$ hours).  
- Train each Martian to pilot the ship (this needs to be done once for every Martian, and takes $\frac{1}{2}$ hour for each Martian).  
- Give them a lunch break (this only needs to be done once, and takes $1$ hour).  
- Train each Martian to land on Earth (this needs to be done once for every Martian, and takes $15$ minutes for each Martian).  
- Travel to earth (this only needs to be done once, and takes $45$ minutes).  

**Will he make it to Earth in time to take over?**  
[[☃ radio 1]]

**If so, how many minutes extra does he have? If not, how many more minutes does he need?**  
[[☃ input-number 1]] minutes

hints.content: Emesto has $9$ tanks.

question.content:
Emesto has $90$ gallons of water. The water was poured equally into tanks. Each tank holds $10$ gallons of water.

**How many tanks does Emesto have?**  
[[☃ input-number 1]] tanks

hints.content: The perimeter of a figure is the sum of the lengths of all of the sides.

The equation $5+3+2+4+ \text{?}=20$ can be used to find the missing side.

The length of the missing side is $6$ units.

question.content:
The five-sided figure shown below has a perimeter of $20$ feet.

**Which equation can be used to find the length of the missing side?**
[[☃ radio 1]]

**What is the length of the missing side?**  
 [[☃ input-number 1]] units
[[☃ image 1]]

hints.content: $\pink{\text{Mixing time}} + \purple{\text{Baking time}} + \blue{\text{Cooling time}} = 30$

$\pink{10} + \purple{14} + \blue{\text{Cooling time}} = 30$

$24+ \blue{\text{Cooling time}} = 30$

$\blue{\text{Cooling time}} = 30 - 24$
Amir lets the cookies cool for $\blue{6}$ minutes.

question.content:
Amir spends $30$ total minutes making chocolate chip cookies. There are $3$ steps required to make the cookies:

$\qquad  1.$ Mix the cookie dough

$\qquad  2.$ Bake the cookies

$\qquad  3.$ Cool the cookies

**If it takes Amir $10$ minutes to mix the cookie dough, and he bakes the cookies for $14$ minutes, how many minutes does he let the cookies cool?**  
 [[☃ input-number 1]] minutes

hints.content: Cost of new books $= 12 \times 20 = 240$

Kai needs $\$240$. He will be paid $\$8$ per foot.
 
Number of feet to paint $= 240 \div 8 = 30$

Kai will paint $30$ feet of the fence out of a total of $50$ feet.  

The fraction painted is $\dfrac{30}{50} = \dfrac{3}{5}$
Kai has to paint $\dfrac{3}{5}$ of the fence.

question.content:
Kai wants to buy $12$ new books for the school library. The books cost $\$20$ each. He wants to earn money by painting part of a $50$ foot long fence for his neighbor. The neighbor will pay Kai $\$8$ for every foot Kai paints.

**How much of the fence (as a fraction) will Kai have to paint?**  
[[☃ input-number 1]]

hints.content: Quadrilaterals have $4$ sides.

$2$ of the $6$ shapes are quadrilaterals.  

$\dfrac{2}{6}=\dfrac{1}{3}$

Cat | $31$

Other | $18$

hints.content:
When rounding to the nearest $10$:

- The *smallest* whole number that will round to $30$ is $25$.
- The *largest* whole number that will round to $30$ is $34$.


When rounding to the nearest hundred:  

- All whole numbers from $150$ to $249$ round to $200$.  
- There are $100$ numbers that round to $200$.

question.content:
When rounding to the nearest $10$:

**What is the smallest whole number that will round to $30$?**   
[[☃ input-number 1]]

**What is the largest whole number that will round to $30$?**   
[[☃ input-number 2]]

When rounding to the nearest hundred:

**How many whole numbers will round to $200$?**  
 [[☃ input-number 3]]

hints.content:
We can find the $\green{\text{number of gumballs purchased}}$ by multiplying the $\blue{\text{number of days}}$ by the $\pink{\text{number purchased per day}}$.

$\blue{30} \times \pink{8} = \green{240}$

We can find the number left in the machine by subtracting the $\green{\text{number of gumballs purchased}}$ from the original $300$.

$300 - \green{240} = \text{?}$
After $30$ days, there are $60$ gumballs left in the machine.

question.content:
The gumball machine at a candy store is filled with $300$ gumballs. Over the course of $30$ days, children purchase $8$ gumballs from the machine each day.

**After these $30$ days, how many gumballs are left in the machine?**   
[[☃ input-number 1]] gumballs

hints.content:
- $\blue{\text{Pat}}$ ate $\blue{\dfrac{1}{4}} = \blue{\dfrac{2}{8}}$ of the pizza.  

- $\pink{\text{Cari}}$ ate $\pink{\dfrac{1}{8}}$ of the pizza.

- $\green{\text{Marcus}}$ ate $\green{\dfrac{3}{8}}$ of the pizza.

The fractions, from least to greatest, are:  

$\pink{\dfrac{1}{8}}, \blue{\dfrac{2}{8}}, \green{\dfrac{3}{8}}$

The order of the names, from least to most pizza eaten, is:  

$\pink{\text{Cari}}, \blue{\text{Pat}}, \green{\text{Marcus}}$

question.content:
Pat, Cari, and Marcus ordered a large pizza, shown below, from their favorite restaurant, Pizza Master.

Pat ate $\dfrac{1}{4}$ of the pizza, Cari ate $\dfrac{1}{8}$ of the pizza, and Marcus ate $\dfrac{3}{8}$ of the pizza.

![](https://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/79a3311123c398384aa0994914709e214f5c3822.png)

**Which is the correct order of names for who ate the least to the most pizza?**  
[[☃ radio 1]]
